message.content:
cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.SI. 

The paper discusses a novel approach to enable fast forwarding and low-latency communications, which is a common concern in networking. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also mentions the application of the proposed approach to different data planes such as MPLS or IPv6, which falls under the category of cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). The use of linear encoding operation and computational efficient routing decisions suggests the involvement of information theory, which is covered in cs.IT (Information Theory). The paper also discusses the security aspect of the proposed approach, which falls under the category of cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). Finally, the paper presents the scalability of the proposed approach, which is a common concern in system design and falls under the category of cs.SI (Systems and Control).
